subject: Re: Wood boxes
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Just for prettyness this time. I was going to buy some plywood, or 
MDF to make a couple box cabinets, but found these wood boxes 
cheaper. I make the enclosures out of whatever I can get/make cheap, 
as store bought enclosures can be kinda pricy. 

 Frank-S


om, psfponies <psfponies@...> wrote:
>
> Werent your early boxes wood? Is there any reason your doing these 
boxex in wood?
>    
>   Kay
> 
> Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>       .hmmessage P  {  margin:0px;  padding:0px  }  
body.hmmessage  {  FONT-SIZE: 10pt;  FONT-FAMILY:Tahoma  }     I 
bought two wood boxes at Hobby Lobby Saturday. Of course the front 
panel is proving to be a challenge, I wanted it wood too, so I'm 
using 1/8 inch mahogany plywood--ever try to drill speaker gril 
holes without splintering the wood!? I don't know why they wood(pun 
intended) say it's on time.  I like this kind of voice, the 
profoundness is in the simplicity. 
>  
>  Frank-S
>
